captions.text:
So, friends,
GRIP is in Abu Dhabi today.

Can you see?
I'm a little sweaty.
It's 113 degrees.

Honestly,
it feels more like 130 in the sun.
But that doesn't matter

because I've been challenged to race
by some Sheikh.

He saw GRIP on YouTube
and wants to kick my butt.
So I said: Sure!
Go ahead and try.
But I don't have a car yet,
so I need to find a badass ride.
Matthias has no idea
what kind of car the Saudi Arabian GRIP fan has.
One thing's for sure, it's not going to be a breeze.
I hope he's got air conditioning.

Do you have air conditioning?
Yeah? Good.
Air conditioning!
They struck oil in Abu Dhabi 50 years ago.
The black gold channeled an vast stream of money
into the region as well.
Money that's often invested in cars.
It's an El Dorado for tuners from around the globe.
Performance boosts "made in Germany" are in high demand.
Matthias has just one day
to prepare for the race against the mysterious Arab.

I heard there's
a little tuning garage around here

that supposedly builds
some wicked cars.
And maybe that's just what I need

to show my race opponent
the lay of the land.
But at this point Matthias doesn't know
what's in store for him in the next 24 hours.
Matthias is on his way to PP-Performance.
The company is largely unknown in Germany.
In the Emirates, among horsepower-hungry Arabs
it's a real insider's tip.
The workshop is outside city limits,
in a barren industrial area
where no tourist would ever stray.

It's supposed to be back there.
I can't wait...
to see what it's like.
I smell sausages.
Hey look,
it's Snoop Dogg's long lost twin.

Hello.
-Hi.
Do you know where PP-Performance is?
No idea. Maybe back there?
Understated, hidden in the back of the courtyard
is a real elite tuner workshop.
Everything here is powerful, fast and expensive.
It's owned by the German Jimmy Pelka and the local Salah Alamoudi.
They swear by the chip tuning of big turbocharged engines.
And the result is brutal power.
This is definitely the place.
Holy crap!
I think they're testing a car.

The guys sitting in that car
are seriously obsessed with speed.

Hi, I'm Matthias.
- Hi, I'm Salah.

I like the car.
Nice flames coming out the back.

Yeah, thanks.
It's a really nice car.

I'm Matthias.
- Nice to meet you.

Nice car.
The flames are totally nuts.

You've gotta have flames.
- What is it?

A BMW X6 M,
4.4 liter V8 bi-turbo.
It had a base of 542 hp.

We boosted it to 710 hp
and 737 lb·ft torque.

Excuse me?
How'd you do that?
It's easy: down-pipes...
That's no problem here,

because here in Abu Dhabi
everybody's wants power.

Everybody wants power,
money is no object.

There's no emission laws...
- No emission laws?

Nobody checks emissions?
- Nope.  - Okay.
I see you added a body kit.

Yes, we made it lighter,
more aerodynamic, lowered it a bit.
So, listen up.

I have a problem...
It's an honor, really.
I've been challenged to a race

and I need a wicked ride,
a real badass weapon.
And this one looks pretty good.

Take it.
- Can I borrow it? - Of course.
Sometimes it's that easy.
By the sounds of it, you should need a gun license to drive this X6 M.
Now the pimped out Bavarian beast just has to prove itself
with an extended test drive.
The famous Abu Dhabi heat isn't just hard on people,
it's murder on these souped-up engines too.
Let's see what this SUV monster can do on the street.
In Germany, this X6 would be nowhere near street legal.
But in the Emirates they turn a blind eye.
Emission laws? Never heard of them.
So the tuned bi-turbo BMW can breathe easy.
It doesn't even have a cat.
The owner, a wealthy car enthusiast,
doesn't seem to care about CO2 emissions.
Because of that,
the 2.4 ton BMW goes 0 to 60 in under 4 seconds,
and has a maximum speed of 211 mph.
It has a price tag of 150,000 euro.

The person who owns this car
is of course relatively well off,

and belongs to
a very well-respected family here.

The funny thing is that
they're all pretty trusting...
... as far as crime is concerned.

For example
he left all his belongings in the car,
and that includes three cellphones.
He left three cellphones in here.

So I'm guessing
he's got two or three more cellphones,

and he doesn't need these right now,
so he left them here.

And that goes for his watches.
He left them in here too.
We've got this one.
There's some bling in there.
But that's just the beginning.
There are enough watches in the car
to finance a small house.
Lookin' good, eh?

It's crazy.
People have so much money here
that cars are like toys to them.

They don't care if the tuning costs
20, 50 or 80,000 euros,

or if the car costs 100, 150, 250...
or 500,000 euros.
They couldn't care less.

Money is no object.
M-I-N-O.
Are these diamonds?
I'm afraid so.
Okay. I'll be very careful.

They're not even in a case,
they're just lying in the door.
Three watches.
Matthias can't wait to dig his spurs into the X6,
and heads toward the highway.

Ah, what do I spy
with my little eye?
A tunnel!
Oh happy day!
Let's have a listen.
Understatements are totally out in Abu Dhabi.
Cars have to be both fast and loud.
No problem for this X6.

Sounds good. Let's see how it sounds
when it goes full throttle.
Maximum speed 75 mph.
The speed limit is no joke in Abu Dhabi...
... usually.
But the local PP-Performance owner Salah has very good contacts.
He's escorting Matthias, so they've made an exception for GRIP:
no limit.
Matthias can test the X6, and push it to the limit.
He's allowed to gun it on a stretch with little traffic.
There's a slight incline. 180.

Is that a police car on the right?
Yup, I think so.
It sure is.
Oh crap.
I just passed a police car going 185!
Shit!
Normally, Matthias would be in some real hot water,
but our guardian has everything under control.
The desert sheriffs stay put.

From this bridge to the second bridge
you can go max speed for 12 miles.
Okay? Have fun but drive carefully.
Okay. Thanks.

Let's try out the launch control.
So, foot on the brake.
Full throttle to 3000 rpm.
And then...
Okay...

That was an all-wheel skid.
It squealed for a second.
Dude, when it slams it into gear,

you have the feeling
it rips through the entire car.

Damn!
It digs its claws into the road.

160.
This feels very relaxed.
The PP-Performance's unchained power
makes it one of the fastest SUV's worldwide.
And not just on paper.
It's 113 degrees outside.

And even at that temperature,
the engine plays along,
and with no complaints.
It's unbelievable actually.

The nice thing is
that this little tuning package

costs exactly 14,000 euros,
including labor.

Nowhere else can you get so much power
for so little money.
Affordable is relative.
The 18.5 gallon tank is empty after 125 miles.
But that's no big deal in the Emirates.

The gas price
is about 1.40 euro per gallon.

That's less than a fourth
of what you'd pay in Germany.
1.40 for super.

We filled the tank of the X6
for under 30 euros.

In Germany that would
definitely cost more than 100 euros.
I think I'm going to move.
It's time to test the fighting skills of the X6 against an opponent.
When evening falls on Abu Dhabi,
all the high-performance hotrods
head to the drag strip.
Every Thursday rich Emirates residents meet
and have head-to-head drag race duels
to determine which car is king of the quarter mile.
You won't see production cars at this horsepower party.
No tuning: no chance.
Even this BMW 1 Series entered the race
with an estimated 493 hp.
Just the right territory for Matthias.
The X6 doesn't stand out in this crowd.
But that's about to change.

As you can see,
we're not alone.

So, let's go see
who's racing against me.

Okay, guys.
Who wants to race me?

You first?
- Yes.

What's your name?
- Khaled.

I'm Matthias. Cool.
- Hi.
Which car do you have?
I've got a BMW M3 CSL.
Okay, I've got the X6.
Okay.

It's been modified a bit.
- Very good. Mine too.
Let's give it a try.
But there's a change in plans before the race begins.
Suddenly a car appears that's famous among all the locals.
Its owner is a member of the ruling family of Abu Dhabi.
His name is Sheikh Khalifa Al Nahyan.
None other than the son of the president.
He knows GRIP from the Internet and wants to race Matthias.
I mean, can you imagine?

That's like
if Angela Merkel had a son

and he hung out at a dragstrip
without bodyguards or anything,

in shorts and a T-shirt.
Yeah, it was incredible.

We meet here in this arena
every week in Abu Dhabi.

We tune our cars
and try to improve a little each week.

To make our cars even faster
and more powerful.

And at the end of the season
we see who has the best car.
Okay, so what kind of car do you have?
A Mercedes SL 65 Black Series.
A Black Series is pretty wicked.

We'll see
if I can do anything about that.
How much horsepower does it have?
Mine has 710.
But your car is really heavy.

Yeah, it weighs a lot more.
We'll see.
Should we begin?

Let's do it.
- Good luck.
Okay.
Usually the Sheikh wins every race with his Black Series.
Okay, this is really intense.
The boss's son wants to race me.
We'll wear helmets, of course.

It's a motorsports event
so it's mandatory.
Suddenly Matthias is faced with a problem he's never had before.

Somebody just whispered to me
to please let the man win.

I'm not sure how I can do that,
to be honest.
But I'll try.

Just drive normally.
Really drive, okay?

So I shouldn't...
- Yes, you can beat him.

He told me not to beat him.
- I just talked to Salah,

and asked,
"Salah, how he should drive,

because Hendrik said
that he's ruling family and all..."
But beat him, it's okay.

You should give it your all,
and drive as fast as you can, okay?

Are you sure?
- Positive.

Just drive normal.
- What does normal mean?

Just drive full acceleration.
- Yeah.
What if I'm faster than him?

It's okay.
- Are you sure?

Yes.
- Did you talk to him?

Yeah, yeah. Don't worry about it.
Tons of other opponents are waiting.
Okay. Okay.
Okay, it's a little crazy here.

Now they told me
to drive as fast as I can after all.
And...
You don't have to tell me twice.

Even though he's
a member of the government,
I should floor it.
Don't worry, Matthias, I'm sure you won't get any lashings.

Oh my god.
I'm scared shitless.
Matthias's rival: 1100 pounds lighter with at least 670 hp.
Does the BMW even stand a chance?

Hot damn!
This X6 is out of control!
That's nuts!
The SL doesn't stand a chance.
So...
It happened.
I just beat the Sheikh's son.
The Black Series was no match for Matthias and his souped up X6.
Normally the Benz with its V12 bi-turbo would take the lead,
but the BMW spreads its vast power over all four wheels
so it's better at transferring power to the road.
Perhaps this will persuade the Sheikh to add another car to his collection.
Its ca. 150,000 euro price tag certainly wouldn't be an issue.
Incredible.

Great race.
- Very good race.

Nice helmet!  Where's your helmet?
- I took it off already. - Okay.

Thank you.
It was quite an honor for me.
Thank you, too.

It was a lot of fun.
The guy was totally chill.

Then he told me he'd seen
lots of episodes of the show.

They watch them on the Internet,
on YouTube.

"Oh, cool, let's watch GRIP."
The videos have English subtitles.

It was pretty cool that
that dude watches us on the Internet.
And the fun is far from over.
The young Arabs can't get enough of drag racing.
They told us that on cooler days
as many as 500 cars line up to drag race in the arena.
That night Matthias and the X6 were challenged repeatedly.
But no matter the opponent,
the result was always the same.
For Matthias, it was straight out of Arabian Nights.
At night in Abu Dhabi
the temperature falls to a comfortable 98.6 degrees,
but the excitement rises.
And because there aren't any emission laws in the Emirates,
the motors roar especially loudly.
But Matthias didn't meet his mysterious challenger on the dragstrip.
He's got a date with him tomorrow on a very different track.

Yeah,
nothing on that thing is original.

That was fun,
but I want to drive some curves
and we'll do that tomorrow.

comments.text:
+MrFliege33  Der Bugatti ist hauptsächlich wegen seines Motors so teuer W16 
das muss man sich mal geben und wegen der extrem teuren Entwicklung auch 
Getriebe Reifen Aerodynamik usw! Ich kann deine Meinung nachvollziehen denn 
wenn man so eine Karre auf pump fährt ist man nicht besonders aber wenn man 
100k hat und den Wagen bar bezahlt muss man ja schon irgendwie was erreicht 
haben im Leben! Aber von der Qualität her sind die immer noch gut klar 
Lexus hält mit aber auf keinen Fall die Plastikbomber aus Amerika wie 
Escalade und wie sie alle heißen!
comments.author: Corvettefan21

comments.text:
+xXShadowProductionsXx siehs doch du ein BMW oder auch Audi und Mercedes 
sind extrem overhyped früher bauten sie noch extrem gute Autos aber leider 
haben die anderen Hersteller nachgezogen und meistens auch locker überholt. 
Jeder der heutzutage so ein Auto fährt denkt gleich er hätte was erreicht 
im Leben und seie besser als die anderen. auch das Preis/Leistungs 
Verhältnis lässt zu wünschen übrig und was ich allgemein nicht verstehen 
kann ist werden BMWs die zwischen 50-80 tausend kosten schon als Luxusauto 
angepriesen wenn ein Bugatti veyron 2mille kostet?

comments.text:
Der Grund warum der X6 Einfach jeden Versägt ist dass er durch den 
Allrad-Antrieb die Traktion auf die Straße bringt. Bei 20:16 sieht man ja 
gut genug dass die Autos zwar Power haben aber der Benz hat geschätzte 
75-100 Meter Weelspin. Also ist der X6 schon richtig gut geeignet auch sein 
Gewicht hat mal einen Vorteil, mehr Bodenhaftung.﻿
